Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110413 Firefox/6.0a1

See the following steps.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set browser.tabs.animate to false in about:config
2. Open enough tabs and close some except two or three
3. Move mouse off the tab bar

Actual Results:  
The remaining tabs grow with animation

Expected Results:  
The animation should not happen

comments.author: blindjudgement@gmail.com
comments.text:
This config option does nothing to disable the new drag animation implemented with Firefox 17.

I also cannot find any option to disable the center effect when dragging tabs on the new version, but that's for another report.  Still, if anyone sees this comment and knows of a way to disable this centering effect, I would greatly appreciate the details, as this change has SEVERELY reduced my efficiency at managing multiple tabs, of which I do on a daily basis (100+ tabs).
